description: Jonah Jones, from Fairmont, Virginia, appears to say, 'Oh no!' after sneezing. The video, posted by dad Gabriel Jones, has been viewed millions of times on social media.
title: Baby Jonah Jones appears to SPEAK when he sneezes in cute video
title_page: Baby Jonah Jones appears to SPEAK when he sneezes in cute video | Daily Mail Online
text:
A proud parent has captured the moment a four-month-old baby appears to defy science by saying, 'Oh no!' after sneezing.
Newborns generally start forming words between 12 and 17 months but little Judah Jones seems to have disproved that theory in the space of just 10 seconds.
In the adorable clip posted to YouTube, Jonah, from Fairmont, West Virginia, is seen being cradled in the arms of a woman - thought to be his mother, Carly - before taking a deep breath and sneezing loudly.
Four-month-old Jonah Jones, from Fairmont, Virginia, appears to exclaim, 'Oh no!' after sneezing. The video, posted online by proud dad Gabriel Jones, has since been viewed millions of times on social media
The onesie-clad baby then appears to say: 'Oh no!' as his mum Carly, laughs: 'That was so cute.'
The heartwarming clip was posted to YouTube by his dad Gabriel Jones with the caption: 'Our cute baby says "oh no" after sneezing. It's hard not to love this!'
It quickly notched up over 90,000 views on YouTube before being shared more than 4.6 million times on Facebook.
Mum Carly, who appeared to be overwhelmed by the reaction, later shared the video on her Facebook page, writing: 'Oh my goodness. My baby is famous.'
Friend Marcy Stewart commented: 'I watched this via someone else's Facebook and thought, "wow, that baby looks like Carly's baby." Too funny!!!' while Kelsey Joy wrote: 'Omg! We watch this at least every hour!'
Baby Jonah Jones takes a deep breath, left, before taking a sneeze and appears to say "Oh no," right
Jonah, pictured with mum Carly, left, and dad Gabriel, centre, has now become an internet sensation
Four-month-old Jonah Jones appeared to say, 'Oh no!' after sneezing. He will now be around seven months
Merisier Caleb wrote: '4M views!! I just played it about 5 times in a row because it was really adorable!!! Such a gentleman huh!!!' while Kaylee Kirkpatrick added: 'Oh my gosh, he really is!!! This is AWESOME!!!'
